title: Strawberry Pie Recipe
description: Strawberry pie is a favorite, and this five-ingredient, picture-perfect version couldn't be easier to whip up. It's a must-try after berry picking!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Desserts Pies Fruit Pies Strawberry Pie Recipes Strawberry Pie 4.6 (1,303) 1,026 Reviews 281 Photos This strawberry pie is my favorite pie, and it's very easy to make. I got the recipe many years ago in North Jersey from the Sussex County Strawberry Farm. Submitted by OKBEE Updated on March 11, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 281 281 281 281 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 3 hrs Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (9-inch) pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 quart fresh strawberries, hulled 1 (9 inch) pie crust, baked 1 cup white sugar 3 tablespoons cornstarch ¾ cup water ½ cup heavy whipping cream Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange 1/2 of strawberries in baked pastry shell. Place remaining strawberries in a medium saucepan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add sugar to the strawberries in the saucepan; place over medium heat and bring to a boil, stirring frequently. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk cornstarch and water together in a small bowl. Gradually stir cornstarch mixture into boiling strawberry mixture. Reduce heat and simmer mixture until thickened, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour cooked strawberry mixture over berries in pastry shell. Refrigerate until chilled and set, at least 3 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Before serving, whip cream in a medium bowl until soft peaks form. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve each slice of pie with a dollop of whipped cream. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,829 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 265 Calories 11g Fat 42g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 265 % Daily Value * Total Fat 11g 14% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 20mg 7% Sodium 109mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 42g 15% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 29g Protein 2g 3% Vitamin C 45mg 50% Calcium 26mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 147mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Strawberry Pie 01 of 281 Photo by  sopenia 02 of 281 Photo by  ThePreserveFarmatLittleChoga 04/02/2025 A keeper! I have made this pie several times for special get togethers. It’s requested now. I paint my crust with chocolate (3 tblsp. butter, 1/2 cup chocolate chips melted in double boiler. Cool to touch. Pour in pie shell and paint up the sides. Place in fridge until chocolate hardens. This keeps the crust from getting soggy.) I also cut the strawberries in the pie shell in half, just because. 03 of 281 Photo by  Cathy M Smith 03/18/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow A keeper! Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Family favorite This Strawberry pie was so very easy to make and was so delicious. I will definitely be making this one again. 04 of 281 Photo by  Corina 08/25/2023 I made this pie for my son's birthday and it was the easiest pie I ever made and it was so delicious! Eveyone loved it! The only think I did differently was use lactose free whipping cream. 05 of 281 Photo by  FairRind1865 06/17/2023 Absolutely LOVE this recipe. The only thing I substituted was Clear Jel Powder for the cornstarch. It turned out perfect. One tip… The strawberry pie filling may take longer to thicken depending on humidity. Today it took 18 minutes to thicken properly. 06 of 281 Photo by  SpeedyScale7211 05/20/2023 I love this pie recipe. It's so easy and delicious! I saw a review where someone couldn't get the sauce to set. Here's what you do for it to set: 1.)Put half of the strawberries into a big sauce pan 2.)take a potato masher and mash the strawberries, then put the sugar on top of it. Cook on medium. It'll start to boil. 3.) In separate bowl add the cornstarch to room temp or cold water. Then mix. 4.) As you're mixing the boiling strawberries and sugar, pour in the mix of cornstarch and water. 5.) Keep stirring for 10 minutes, usually I put it between medium and low, keeping it bubbling but slowly lowering the temp to low over 10 minutes. 6.) After 10 minutes take it off the heat and pour it on that beautiful crust you made, with half of the strawberries on it 7.) Regarding the crust, usually this is my first step. I'll be lazy and buy the Pillsbury pie crust and roll that onto a pie tin after it's been out of the fridge for 15 minutes. Take a fork and poke it all over the bottom and sides of your pie crust. Cook that at 450f for 10 minutes. Then let it cool for about 30. Usually I do this first so I can do everything else while it cools. 8.) Anyways put the pie into the fridge for a few hours, usually I let it sit overnight, it doesn't need to be that long but I don't know, it really makes it work. 9) take 1 pint of heavy cream and add 3 table spoons of sugar into mixing bowl and put it on high until you see those nice peaks. My mom loves whipped cream and she's getting this pie for her birthday dessert, so I pile it on top. Of hers at least, some people can't do dairy, so only add it if they want it. 07 of 281 Photo by  BoldChop3330 04/22/2023 I love this recipe. I changed the pie crust to Graham cracker crust and I add one tablespoon of lemon juice. I also pureed the strawberries that I cooked. I let it cooked for 3 hours and refrigerated over night. It came out great. I have made 3 pies and have away 2 of the pies. Everyone loves them 08 of 281 Photo by  SereneMash4368 03/11/2023 Added about 1/4 of a teaspoon of lemon juice to it at the end to make it more tart. Was delicious 09 of 281 Photo by  bevvie 07/26/2022 Really good pie. Everyone enjoyed it! 10 of 281 Photo by  bevvie 07/26/2022 Really good pie. Everyone enjoyed it! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love The Old Boy's Strawberry Pie 391 Ratings Two Tier Strawberry Pie 150 Ratings Strawberry Rhubarb Custard Pie 223 Ratings Old-Fashioned Strawberry Pie 300 Ratings Becky's Strawberry Pie 49 Ratings Fresh Strawberry Pie with Jell-O 348 Ratings Fresh Strawberry Pie with Orange Liqueur Glaze 9 Ratings Mini Strawberry Tarts 10 Ratings Strawberry Shortcake 489 Ratings Strawberry Pretzel Pie 93 Ratings Cheesecake in a Jar 92 Ratings Fresh Strawberry Tart 11 Ratings Grandma's Strawberry Rhubarb Pie 47 Ratings Strawberry Pie without Jell-O 2 Ratings Easy as Pie Strawberry Pie 18 Ratings Summer Fresh Strawberry Pie 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
